title: Spack install could not find shared libraries when using external compilers
body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue
I come up with the following issue while trying to installing libraries using external compilers. Here I just use adol-c as an example.

```console
$ spack spec adol-c
Input spec
--------------------------------
adol-c

Concretized
--------------------------------
adol-c@2.7.2%gcc@9.2.0~advanced_branching+atrig_erf~boost+doc+examples~openmp~sparse arch=linux-centos7-zen2

$ spack install adol-c
==> Installing adol-c-2.7.2-fuxgdfh2a5u6luxg537vrz4yhkktegii
==> No binary for adol-c-2.7.2-fuxgdfh2a5u6luxg537vrz4yhkktegii found: installing from source
==> Using cached archive: /opt/spack/var/spack/cache/_source-cache/archive/70/701e0856baae91b98397960d5e0a87a549988de9d4002d0e9a56fa08f5455f6e.tar.gz
==> No patches needed for adol-c
==> adol-c: Executing phase: 'autoreconf'
==> adol-c: Executing phase: 'configure'
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 77:
    '/tmp/cjyin/spack-stage/spack-stage-adol-c-2.7.2-fuxgdfh2a5u6luxg537vrz4yhkktegii/spack-src/configure' '--prefix=/opt/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-zen2/gcc-9.2.0/adol-c-2.7.2-fuxgdfh2a5u6luxg537vrz4yhkktegii' '--with-boost=no' '--enable-atrig-erf' '--enable-docexa' '--enable-addexa'

2 errors found in build log:
     9     checking whether make supports nested variables... yes
     10    checking whether make supports nested variables... (cached) yes
     11    checking whether to enable maintainer-specific portions of Makefiles... no
     12    checking whether to build ADOL-C with adjoinable MPI (AMPI) support... no
     13    checking whether to build ADOL-C with MeDiPack (MPI) support... no
     14    checking whether the C++ compiler works... no
  >> 15    configure: error: in `/tmp/cjyin/spack-stage/spack-stage-adol-c-2.7.2-fuxgdfh2a5u6luxg537vrz4yhkktegii/spack-src':
  >> 16    configure: error: C++ compiler cannot create executables
     17    See `config.log' for more details

See build log for details:
  /tmp/cjyin/spack-stage/spack-stage-adol-c-2.7.2-fuxgdfh2a5u6luxg537vrz4yhkktegii/spack-build-out.txt
```

Since the external compilers are managed by `module`, I thus add `extra_rpaths` to the `compilers.yaml` file
```yaml
- compiler:
    spec: gcc@9.2.0
    paths:
      cc: /data/apps/software/gcc-9.2.0/bin/gcc
      cxx: /data/apps/software/gcc-9.2.0/bin/g++
      f77: /data/apps/software/gcc-9.2.0/bin/gfortran
      fc: /data/apps/software/gcc-9.2.0/bin/gfortran
    flags: {}
    operating_system: centos7
    target: x86_64
    modules: []
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths:
      - /data/apps/software/gcc-9.2.0/lib
      - /data/apps/software/gcc-9.2.0/lib64
      - /data/apps/software/mpc-1.2.1/lib
      - /data/apps/software/gmp-6.2.1/lib
      - /data/apps/software/mpfr-4.1.0/lib
```

However, it seems the configure procedure still couldn't find the shared libraries even though it specifies `--with-mpfr`
```log
configure:3748: checking for C++ compiler version
configure:3757: /opt/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/g++ --version >&5
g++ (GCC) 9.2.0
Copyright (C) 2019 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
This is free software; see the source for copying conditions.  There is NO
warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

configure:3768: $? = 0
configure:3757: /opt/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/g++ -v >&5
Using built-in specs.
COLLECT_GCC=/data/apps/software/gcc-9.2.0/bin/g++
COLLECT_LTO_WRAPPER=/data/apps/software/gcc-9.2.0/libexec/gcc/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/9.2.0/lto-wrapper
Target: x86_64-pc-linux-gnu
Configured with: ../configure --prefix=/data/apps/software/gcc-9.2.0 --with-gmp=/data/apps/software/gmp-6.2.1 --with-mpfr=/data/apps/software/mpfr-4.1.0 --with-mpc=/data/apps/software/mpc-1.2.1 --disable-multilib --enable-libstdcxx-time=yes --enable-stage1-checking --enable-checking=release --with-build-config=bootstrap-debug --disable-werror --disable-nls
Thread model: posix
gcc version 9.2.0 (GCC) 
configure:3768: $? = 0
configure:3757: /opt/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/g++ -V >&5
g++: error: unrecognized command line option '-V'
g++: fatal error: no input files
compilation terminated.
configure:3768: $? = 1
configure:3757: /opt/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/g++ -qversion >&5
g++: error: unrecognized command line option '-qversion'; did you mean '--version'?
configure:3768: $? = 1
configure:3788: checking whether the C++ compiler works
configure:3810: /opt/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/g++    conftest.cpp  >&5
/data/apps/software/gcc-9.2.0/libexec/gcc/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/9.2.0/cc1plus: error while loading shared libraries: libmpfr.so.6: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
configure:3814: $? = 1
configure:3852: result: no
configure: failed program was:
| /* confdefs.h */
| #define PACKAGE_NAME "adolc"
| #define PACKAGE_TARNAME "adolc"
| #define PACKAGE_VERSION "2.7.2"
| #define PACKAGE_STRING "adolc 2.7.2"
| #define PACKAGE_BUGREPORT "adol-c@list.coin-or.org"
| #define PACKAGE_URL ""
| #define PACKAGE "adolc"
| #define VERSION "2.7.2"
| /* end confdefs.h.  */
| 
| int
| main ()
| {
| 
|   ;
|   return 0;
| }
configure:3857: error: in `/tmp/cjyin/spack-stage/spack-stage-adol-c-2.7.2-fuxgdfh2a5u6luxg537vrz4yhkktegii/spack-src':
configure:3859: error: C++ compiler cannot create executables
```
I've seen similar issues in #6 and #16032, but they seem to be outdated and still remain open respectively.

### Information on your system
The shared library files do exists in the path and variable `LD_LIBRARY_PATH`
```console
$ ll /data/apps/software/mpfr-4.1.0/lib/
total 3836
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root 1088648 Dec 14  2020 libmpfr.a
-rwxr-xr-x 1 root root    1039 Dec 14  2020 libmpfr.la
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root      16 Dec 14  2020 libmpfr.so -> libmpfr.so.6.1.0
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root      16 Dec 14  2020 libmpfr.so.6 -> libmpfr.so.6.1.0
-rwxr-xr-x 1 root root 2829232 Dec 14  2020 libmpfr.so.6.1.0
drwxr-xr-x 2 root root    4096 Dec 14  2020 pkgconfig
```
The platform I use is
```console
$ spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.16.2-3242-387ee5a0b7
* **Python:** 3.8.5
* **Platform:** linux-centos7-zen2
* **Concretizer:** original
```

### Additional information

<!-- Please upload the following files. They should be present in the stage directory of the failing build. Also upload any config.log or similar file if one exists. -->
* [config.log](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/6829491/config.log)
* [spack-build-env.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/6829515/spack-build-env.txt)

### General information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have uploaded the build log and environment files
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
